RAD552.name: Medical Neuroscience
RAD552.description: Correlation of normal structure and function of the human nervous system with clinical testing, classical lesions, and common diseases.
RAD552.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the Colleges of Human Medicine and Osteopathic Medicine.

RAD590.name: Independent Study in Radiology
RAD590.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
RAD590.description: Independent study in areas such as clinical diagnostic radiology, radiological physics, or radiological information technology.

RAD609.name: Radiology Clerkship
RAD609.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
RAD609.description: Diagnostic imaging consultation. Participation in image interpretation and observation in hospital or out-patient radiology setting. Radiological procedure guideline and patient safety and comfort. Complications of radiological procedures.
RAD609.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine or in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

RAD610.name: Core Radiology Clerkship
RAD610.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
RAD610.description: Diagnostic imaging consultation. Participation in image interpretation and observation in hospital or out-patient radiology setting.
RAD610.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

RAD612.name: Interventional Radiology
RAD612.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
RAD612.description: Fundamentals of radiation biology, diagnostic and therapeutic techniques, safety, and follow-up of interventional radiology procedures.
RAD612.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine or in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.
